name: PersistFolderCreation
description:
Create a new persisted folder in Datadog.

Use this tool to create a new persisted folder within a specified project in Datadog. It is called when organizing or categorizing project assets in a dedicated folder is needed.

parameters.name: project_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the target project. Retrieve it via /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: folder_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the folder. Possible values are 'home' for Home or 'pinned' for Pinned.

parameters.name: folder_category
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the persisted folder. Options are 'home' for Home or 'pinned' for Pinned.

parameters.name: folder_creation_date
parameters.description: The date and time when the persisted folder is created, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: folder_last_updated
parameters.description: A string representing the timestamp of the last update to the folder, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: folder_protocol
parameters.description: Specify the protocol for the persisted folder. Expected values are network protocol types like HTTP or FTP.

parameters.name: folder_path
parameters.description: Specify the path where the persisted folder will be created within the project. It should be a string representing the directory structure needed.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the PostHog API.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
